intro: Calawaya jostii, commonly known as the Jost's calawaya, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered. Conservation efforts are underway to protect and propagate this unique species.
